Sie argumentieren, dass erwachsene Individuen das Recht haben, selbst über ihre Informations- und Unterhaltungsquellen zu entscheiden, solange keine Dritte schädigend betroffen sind. Der Supreme Court hat in verschiedenen Entscheidungen klargestellt, dass explizite sexuelle Inhalte, die nicht als "unanständig" im Sinne des Miller-Tests klassifiziert werden, unter dem Schutz der freien Rede fallen.    - Whether the average person, applying contemporary community standards, would find that the work, taken as a whole, appeals to the prurient interest.
   - Whether the work depicts or describes, in a patently offensive way, sexual conduct specifically defined by applicable state law.
   - Whether the work, taken as a whole, lacks serious literary, artistic, political, or scientific value. (Source: [Miller v. California, 413 U.S. 15 (1973)](https://supreme.justia.com/cases/federal/us/413/15/))

5. **Incest**: Depictions of incest (sexual acts between close family members) are illegal in many states, particularly if they involve minors.
